org.apache.flink.spargel.java

Class VertexCentricIteration<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.spargel.java.VertexCentricIteration<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue>
  • Type Parameters:
    VertexKey - The type of the vertex key (the vertex identifier).
    VertexValue - The type of the vertex value (the state of the vertex).
    Message - The type of the message sent between vertices along the edges.
    EdgeValue - The type of the values that are associated with the edges.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomUnaryOperation<Tuple2<VertexKey,VertexValue>,Tuple2<VertexKey,VertexValue>>

    public class VertexCentricIteration<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue>
extends Object
implements CustomUnaryOperation<Tuple2<VertexKey,VertexValue>,Tuple2<VertexKey,VertexValue>>
    This class represents iterative graph computations, programmed in a vertex-centric perspective. It is a special case of Bulk Synchronous Parallel computation. The paradigm has also been implemented by Google's Pregel system and by Apache Giraph.

    Vertex centric algorithms operate on graphs, which are defined through vertices and edges. The algorithms send messages along the edges and update the state of vertices based on the old state and the incoming messages. All vertices have an initial state. The computation terminates once no vertex updates it state any more. Additionally, a maximum number of iterations (supersteps) may be specified.

    The computation is here represented by two functions:

    • The VertexUpdateFunction receives incoming messages and may updates the state for the vertex. If a state is updated, messages are sent from this vertex. Initially, all vertices are considered updated.
    • The MessagingFunction takes the new vertex state and sends messages along the outgoing edges of the vertex. The outgoing edges may optionally have an associated value, such as a weight.

    Vertex-centric graph iterations are instantiated by the withPlainEdges(DataSet, VertexUpdateFunction, MessagingFunction, int) method, or the withValuedEdges(DataSet, VertexUpdateFunction, MessagingFunction, int) method, depending on whether the graph's edges are carrying values.

    • Method Detail

      • registerAggregator

        public void registerAggregator(String name,
                               Aggregator<?> aggregator)
        Registers a new aggregator. Aggregators registered here are available during the execution of the vertex updates via VertexUpdateFunction.getIterationAggregator(String) and VertexUpdateFunction.getPreviousIterationAggregate(String).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the aggregator, used to retrieve it and its aggregates during execution.
        aggregator - The aggregator.

        Parameters:

        data - The data set to be broadcasted.

        public void setInput(DataSet<Tuple2<VertexKey,VertexValue>> inputData)

      • withPlainEdges

        public static final <VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message> VertexCentricIteration<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message,?> withPlainEdges(DataSet<Tuple2<VertexKey,VertexKey>> edgesWithoutValue,
                                                                                                                                                         VertexUpdateFunction<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message> vertexUpdateFunction,
                                                                                                                                                         MessagingFunction<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message,?> messagingFunction,
                                                                                                                                                         int maximumNumberOfIterations)
        Creates a new vertex-centric iteration operator for graphs where the edges are not associated with a value.
        Type Parameters:
        VertexKey - The type of the vertex key (the vertex identifier).
        VertexValue - The type of the vertex value (the state of the vertex).
        Message - The type of the message sent between vertices along the edges.
        Parameters:
        edgesWithoutValue - The data set containing edges. Edges are represented as 2-tuples: (source-id, target-id)
        vertexUpdateFunction - The function that updates the state of the vertices from the incoming messages.
        messagingFunction - The function that turns changed vertex states into messages along the edges.
        Returns:
        An in stance of the vertex-centric graph computation operator.

      • withValuedEdges

        public static final <VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue> VertexCentricIteration<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue> withValuedEdges(DataSet<Tuple3<VertexKey,VertexKey,EdgeValue>> edgesWithValue,

                                                                                                                                                                            int maximumNumberOfIterations)
        Creates a new vertex-centric iteration operator for graphs where the edges are associated with a value (such as a weight or distance).
        Type Parameters:
        VertexKey - The type of the vertex key (the vertex identifier).
        VertexValue - The type of the vertex value (the state of the vertex).
        Message - The type of the message sent between vertices along the edges.
        EdgeValue - The type of the values that are associated with the edges.
        Parameters:
        edgesWithValue - The data set containing edges. Edges are represented as 2-tuples: (source-id, target-id)
        uf - The function that updates the state of the vertices from the incoming messages.
        mf - The function that turns changed vertex states into messages along the edges.
        Returns:
        An in stance of the vertex-centric graph computation operator.
